X.iv.2.B.1.a
.
Effect of a Homicide Determination on the Right to Benefits
The issue of homicide, or wrongful death, is a question of fact.  Whether or not a claimant or beneficiary wrongfully and intentionally caused the death of a Veteran or another beneficiary affects the right of a claimant to Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) benefits.
Important
:  Even if VA makes a favorable determination about a claimant’s involvement in the death of a Veteran or other beneficiary, incarceration of the claimant may affect payment of benefits.
References
:  For more information on
the prohibition of benefits due to wrongful death, see
38 CFR 3.11
, and
adjustment of benefits due to incarceration, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.A
.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, Chapter 2, Section B  - Considering Eligibility When Homicide Is Involved
